DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the patient's prothrombin time is within the criteria set by the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient's blood.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient's PT (INR) wit
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's PT (INR) within the criteria set by the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the PT INR less than or equal to 1.5 (or an in-range INR, usually between 2 and 3, if a patient is on a stable dose of therapeutic warfarin) and the PTT less than 1.2 times the Upper Limit of Normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: INR <1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) unless patients are receiving anti-coagulation therapy. Patients receiving prophylactic anti-coagulation therapy with an agent such as warfarin or heparin are allowed to participate if INR <=3.0

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are PT and APTT less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate coagulation as defined by protocol

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the PT/aPTT less than 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have the patient's international normalized ratio of prothrombin time (INR) and prothrombin time (PT) been within normal limits for the lab in the past 28 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient's international normalized ratio of prothrombin time (INR) been <= upper limit of normal (ULN) for the lab in the past 28 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is their medication dose and INR/PTT stable?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Labs Ind-2  2181518v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
